title.bibl: Lietuva, Apr. 27, 1917. Chicago Lithuanians Volunteer for War Service

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

div.bibl: Lietuva, Apr. 27, 1917. CHICAGO LITHUANIANS VOLUNTEER FOR WAR SERVICE

body.p: It is reported that a fairly large number of Chicago Lithuanians have volunteered for service in the United States Army and Navy. Frank Kibortas has enlisted in the officersâ€™ reserve training school, and will leave soon for Fort Sheridan, where he will join about five hundred other volunteers to be trained as officers in the army. Joseph Judeikis, of Town of Lake, has joined the United States Navy, and has already left Chicago. P. Glebaitis, who was formerly in the real-estate business and who was also an automobile dealer, has enlisted in the First Infantry Regiment in Chicago.
A large number of other Lithuanians have volunteered, but their names are not available at this time.
